page.title: 14RELIGIION IN KETTLEWELL
page.content: Scargill House - Once privately owned, this is now a Christian Guest House and Conference Centre. It is a fine stone-built complex with a Scandinavian type chapel, clearly visible on the Conistone road out of the village. Since 1958 it has housed a community of young men and women working together who share their faith with visitors and friends. There are ninety acres of woodland and meadow, backed by limestone outcrops.Up to 90 guests can be catered for in beautiful accommodation, extended to include an octagonal lounge and new bedroom blocks. "Specialised" weeks are organised for all ages. The Community often share in worship in the village church, and help with activities as far as their commitments allow, inviting villagers each year to a specially devised party.
